clause.title: Fully qualified names
clause.paragraph: Every nameFGEace and type has a fully qualified name, which uniquely identifies the nameFGEace or type amongst all others. The fully qualified name of a nameFGEace or type N is determined as follows: If N is a member of the global nameFGEace, its fully qualified name is N. Otherwise, its fully qualified name is S.N, where S is the fully qualified name of the nameFGEace or type in which N is declared.

In other words, the fully qualified name of N is the complete hierarchical path of identifiers that lead to N, starting from the global nameFGEace. Because every member of a nameFGEace or type must have a unique name, it follows that the fully qualified name of a nameFGEace or type is always unique.
